SEARCH
Package com.dua3.meja.model

Interface Cell

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractCell, GenericCell, PoiCell
public interface Cell
A single cell of a sheet.

Units: Any size-related values derived from this cell (e.g., values returned by calcCellDimension()) are measured in typographical points (1/72 inch), independent of device pixels.

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Interface
    Description
    static class 
    Cell.CellException
    The CellException class is an exception that extends the IllegalStateException class.

    • getAsText

      com.dua3.utility.text.RichText getAsText(Locale locale)
      Return the textual representation of the cell's value as RichText, without applying the cell style.

      This method converts the underlying value to text using the given locale, but does not apply the cell's visual style (font, fill colors, etc.). Use getAsFormattedText(Locale) when you need the value as it would appear to the user, including cell styling.

      Examples (assuming a cell with numeric value 1234.5 and a German locale):

      • cell.getAsText(Locale.GERMANY) → RichText("1234.5") (no thousand separator, no style)
      • cell.getAsFormattedText(Locale.GERMANY) → RichText("1.234,5") (formatted, styled)
      • cell.toString(Locale.GERMANY) → "1.234,5" (plain String, formatted)
      Parameters:
      locale - the locale to use during formatting
      Returns:
      the cell value as a RichText instance without applying cell style
      See Also:
      • getAsFormattedText(Locale)
      • toString(Locale)

    • getAsFormattedText

      default com.dua3.utility.text.RichText getAsFormattedText(Locale locale)
      Return the textual representation of the cell's value as it would be displayed, with the cell style applied.

      This method applies the cell's visual style (font, fills) to the textual value generated for the given locale. It is suitable for UI display when you want to preserve styling information in the returned RichText.

      Examples (assuming a date value 2025-01-02 and the cell style uses a short date pattern):

      • cell.getAsText(Locale.US) → RichText("2025-01-02") (raw text, no style)
      • cell.getAsFormattedText(Locale.US) → RichText("1/2/25") (formatted and styled)
      • cell.toString(Locale.US) → "1/2/25" (plain String, formatted)
      Parameters:
      locale - the locale to use during formatting
      Returns:
      the value as RichText, including cell style
      See Also:
      • getAsText(Locale)
      • toString(Locale)

    • getHorizontalSpan

      int getHorizontalSpan()
      Get the horizontal span.

      The horizontal span of a merged cells is the horizontal number of merged cells for the top left cell of the merged cells and 0 for the other merged cells. For cells that are not merged, the span is 1.

      Returns:
      horizontal span for this cell

    • getLogicalCell

      Cell getLogicalCell()
      Get the logical cell. The logical cell for merged cells is the top left cell of the group of merged cells. For cells that are not merged, the logical cell is the cell itself.
      Returns:
      the logical cell

    • getNumber

      Number getNumber()
      Return numeric value.
      Returns:
      numeric cell value
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if cell is not of numeric type

    • getResultType

      CellType getResultType()
      Return the result type.

      For non-formula cells, this is the same as the value returned by getCellType(). For formula cells, the result type of the last evaluation is returned.

      Note: Since excel doesn't know about dates internally and date cells are determined by looking at both cell type and format, the cell style has to be set before calling this method to make sure CellType.DATE is returned for formulas that return a date.

      Returns:
      cell type

    • getRow

      Row getRow()
      Get the row this cell belongs to.
      Returns:
      the row for this cell

    • getVerticalSpan

      int getVerticalSpan()
      Get the vertical span.

      The vertical span of a merged cells is the vertical number of merged cells for the top left cell of the merged cells and 0 for the other merged cells. For cells that are not merged, the span is 1.

      Returns:
      vertical span for this cell

    • set

      default Cell set(@Nullable Object arg)
      Set cell value.

      Use this method when the exact type of the value object is not known at compile time. Depending on the runtime-type, the corresponding overload of Cell.set(...) is called. if value is null, the cell is cleared. If no overload of Cell.set(...) matches the runtime type of value, the cell value is set to String.valueOf(value).

      The following types are supported:
      • Number
      • Boolean
      • LocalDateTime
      • LocalDate
      • String
      • RichText
      Parameters:
      arg - the value
      Returns:
      this cell

    • set

      Parameters:

    • getResolvedHyperlink

      default Optional<URI> getResolvedHyperlink()
      Get resolved Hyperlink.

      Note: Absolute URIs are returned unchanged; relative URIs are resolved against the workbook URI.

      Returns:
      an Optional with the resolved Hyperlink or an empty Optional
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if a relative link exists but the workbook URI is not set

      default boolean isError()
      Check for error.

      true, if the cell type is ERROR

    • calcCellDimension

      default com.dua3.utility.math.geometry.Dimension2f calcCellDimension()
      Calculate the dimension of the cell based on the cell's content.

      The returned Dimension2f is measured in typographical points (1/72 inch) and reflects the content as it would be displayed using the cell's font and rotation. A small padding is applied to width and height to account for spacing.

      Returns:
      the calculated dimension of the cell in typographical points (1/72 inch)

    • toString

      String toString()
      Return string representation of cell content.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      string representation of cell content

    • toString

      String toString(Locale locale)
      Return the localized string representation of the cell's value.

      This method returns a plain String suitable for display or export (e.g., CSV). It formats the value using the provided locale and the cell's data format, but does not carry styling information. For a styled representation, use getAsFormattedText(Locale). For a non-styled RichText, use getAsText(Locale).

      Examples:

      • Number 1234.5 with German locale: cell.toString(Locale.GERMANY) → "1.234,5"
      • Date 2025-01-02 with US locale (short date style): cell.toString(Locale.US) → "1/2/25"
      Parameters:
      locale - locale for formatting
      Returns:
      string representation of the cell content for the given locale
      See Also:
      • getAsText(Locale)
      • getAsFormattedText(Locale)

    • unMerge

      void unMerge()
      Unmerge cell.
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if this cell is not the top left cell of a merged region

    • isMerged

      default boolean isMerged()
      Test if the cell is merged.

      Merge cell with neighboring cells.
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      this cell after merging

    • getEffectiveBorderStyle

      default BorderStyle getEffectiveBorderStyle(Direction direction)
      Returns the effective border style for the specified direction. The effective border style is determined by the cell's border style and the border style of its neighboring cell.
      Parameters:
      direction - the direction of the border
      Returns:
      the effective border style for the specified direction
